Reviews.Title: great machine!!!
Reviews.Author: Ozgur Bozkurt "ozzie"
Reviews.Content: best desktop replacement laptop out there ... super fast (even faster if you replace the HD that came with it), super sleek - as thin as ultrabooks, no keyboard flex, back lit keyboard, light sensors to adjust the keyboard and screen brightness, discreet graphics card ... etc.samsung has another version of this - np880z5e - it is "supposedly" new, but it is exactly the same as this computer ... since this is an "older" model with exact specs and looks, I recommend getting this model instead of the np880z5e / ativ book 8 - it is exactly the same machine with a name difference BUT a few hundred dollars cheaper ;)overall it is a great machine!!!! You will not regret getting it  :)

Reviews.Title: Incredible.
Reviews.Author: Alex Ellsworth
Reviews.Content: This laptop is a monster. Extremely powerful machine. I replaced my gaming rig for this to be more portable. Plays games on all high quality without any issues. Put a Samsung 840 Pro 256GB ssd in this thing and with Rapid Mode enabled, I am pushing over 1.2GB/s read & write. Also upgraded the RAM to 12GB 1600MHz. The battery on power saver I get between 12-16 hours (wifi/bluetooth on, screen brightness turned down). On high performance on the battery while playing games (using the radeon graphics card), I get about 3-5 hours of straight gaming (GTA IV, BF3, BeamNG.Drive).Things I do not like: I hate the wireless card. Cannot stand it, Intel needs to completely redesign the drivers because it is just crap. Constantly having to type in the wireless password over and over. Uninstalled/Reinstalled/Old/New drivers, nothing fixes it. Thinking about upgrading the wireless card to the Intel AC Dual Band card.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice
Reviews.Author: Juan Casal
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy a new laptop and since i used to own a Samsung previously i chose this model. The outcome was excellent, its a great laptop, fast, stylish, light and with great features.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Laptop
Reviews.Author: John Ostrander
Reviews.Content: I love this computer. At the time it was the best at its price point, and it still boasts some rather impressive specs. The one flaw of this computer is the mouse which does not have stand alone buttons for right and left clicking. I knew this when I bought it and had thought that I'd adapt, but even after six months of use it continues to be difficult nigh impossible to use. I like Samsung products, but this really kills the user experience. I'll probably stick with a more expensive thinkpad in the future rather than fight with this.Samsung if you read this then please stop using this type of mouse on your products because I'd really like to keep your products as potentials.
